##An old man died 800 kilometers away | from the outbreak 005

Wechat, cang1she

Features, you've never seen the city of martial arts

[ under the epidemic ] is a non-fiction column by the Cangyi Society, which documents the reports of ordinary Chinese fighting the COVID-19 epidemic as it spread.

Hi, I'm uncle face.

The first thing I do when I wake up in the morning is watch the live feed of the NCP epidemic. With the number of confirmed cases on the rise, the inflection point is not yet known. So far, 1,368 people have died from the disease. This is not a cold list of numbers, but the deaths of 1,368 families.

Outside the affected areas, there are also people who are in the shadow of the disaster. However, they are not listed as having died of pneumonia.

This is the fifth report under the epidemic situation
Who will not be recorded
Location: A mountain village in the southeast of Hebei Province
When: january-february 2020
4,137 words, about 5 minutes to read

Hi, I'm uncle face.

The first thing I do when I wake up in the morning is watch the live feed of the NCP epidemic. With the number of confirmed cases on the rise, the inflection point is not yet known. So far, 1,368 people have died from the disease. This is not a cold list of numbers, but the deaths of 1,368 families.

Outside the affected areas, there are also people who are in the shadow of the disaster. However, they are not listed as having died of pneumonia.

This is the fifth report under the epidemic situation

Who will not be recorded

Location: A mountain village in the southeast of Hebei Province

When: january-february 2020

4,137 words, about 5 minutes to read

The second day of the Lunar New Year is the day when a married daughter returns to her mother's home to visit her family. MEEMAW's staying with us, so we don't have to go through this. Since the winter vacation back, I accompany grandma every day, she smiled from ear to ear, nothing stuffed hemp candy bar to me to eat. You're welcome, too. Take the Candy Bar, and go all the way from the tip of your tongue to the bottom of your heart.

Grandma is eighty-four this year, her hair is all white, a little fat, slightly protruding a small belly, very cute. She has two hobbies, one is knitting, the other is paper-cutting. The sweaters made by grandma are more beautiful than those sold on the market. She cuts the Chinese characters for blessings, window decorations, small animals and lanterns at home by hand.

A sweater knitted by grandma

My home is in a small mountain village in the southeast of Hebei Province. The map shows that it is more than 800 kilometers from Wuhan.

On the second day of the Lunar New Year, roads were closed in the village. Eleven entrances and exits, big and small, were blocked except for the main entrance. Members of the village committee sit at the main entrance, holding banners that read "non-members of the village are strictly prohibited from entering the village, all are urged to return. ".

Village loudspeakers have been circulating since 6 a.m. : "More Ventilation, AH, wash your hands frequently, less going out, AH, wear a mask, don't run around Ah, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH, AH. "

I am very active, every time I go home and my brother walk the streets not home. But now special period, also can only obediently stay at home, help her mother every day cooking and washing the dishes.

Next thing I know, I'm at home for almost a week. After lunch, grandma said, "Yushang, I'm almost out of medicine. "

Mother was stunned. "How many more days? "

"Five days. "

"Yes, I'll try to get someone to get the medicine. "

Grandma has "three high" , high blood fat, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, according to the doctor's instructions, need to take a variety of drugs. Some medicines can be bought at the drugstore, and some require a doctor's prescription. Usually, my mom would go to the county central hospital to get her medicine. Grandma had a history of cerebral thrombosis, and if she didn't take her medication, she was at great risk.

I ran up to grandma and said, "grandma, don't worry, I'll get your medicine. "

My mother gave me a blank look.

In the afternoon, mother called the doctor of the Central Hospital. The doctor said it was OK to get the medicine. My Dad's a little worried. It's a crazy time, and there's another suspected pneumonia at county general.

Dad said, "I don't approve of your going. "

Mother said: "Then how to do? Wait for medicine to eat up, then think of a way to be late. "

Dad was a little impatient, "you don't listen to the loudspeakers every day, if you go to the hospital, the village knows that you must be isolated! "

The closed path

"Then tomorrow I'll open a letter to the village brigade. I'll be careful... "

Mother's words did not finish, was interrupted by Dad, "you have to put yourself in isolation to clear the heart, isn't it? "

Mom bowed her head, "then how to do, it is Niang Ah, I can watch her ignore it? Do not say, and tomorrow I go to the hospital to get medicine, take the initiative to quarantine, nothing later I come back. "

Dad did not speak again, out of the door, in the yard, "Da da Da da Da" to smoke.

I didn't get much sleep that night, and I wanted to go with mom, and she said No.

The next morning, mom said she couldn't make it today. Central Hospital doctors sent her a message early in the morning, said the Central Hospital drug sales, medical staff focused on the prevention and treatment of pneumonia. The suspected patient at the hospital was diagnosed last night.

The confirmed pneumonia patient, who had been hospitalized with a heart attack, was said to have had visitors from Wuhan. Now that he has been diagnosed, the doctors, nurses, patients, relatives and friends he came into contact with have been put under quarantine. The county's Central Hospital is practically a quarantine zone.

Mom did not go, dad seemed relieved, "is not four days of medicine, and then two days, I come to think of a way. "

"then wait two more days. "

Grandma has no children. Mom is her adopted daughter. Grandmother's own sister gave birth to six children, no ability to support, they will be given to the mother of no fertility grandmother. When she was a child, she was afraid of the dark, ghosts and thunder. Grandma doted on her. When she was sixteen, her mother still had to sleep with her.

My Mother didn't trust me, she didn't marry far away, and she became a family with my father in this village. GRANDPA passed away a few years ago, and grandma had a stroke. After that, mom brought grandma to stay with us.

My parents were busy when I was a child. I was brought up by my grandma and GRANDPA. I lived in an old folks'home until I was twelve.

By February 3rd, MEEMAW's medicine will be ready in three days. After dinner, I watched TV in my grandmother's room, while my mother worked in the kitchen. Grandma walked over to me and sat down. "Wrap Up. I want to move back to the old folks' home. "

"Grandma, why are you moving back? There's no heat and no food in that yard. "

"I miss your GRANDPA. "

"Then I'll go with you. "

Grandma shook her head. "No, I'll go alone. "

"Does my mother know about this? "

"I'll tell her later. I'll move there tomorrow morning, and when the sun comes up in the afternoon, I'll go to the county hospital. Don't tell your mother about me going to the hospital. "

"Grandma, you... "

"Wrap Up, listen to me, I will live to be eighty-four this year, only a few years left to live. Your mother is forty-two, and half her life, and you are only nineteen, and life is long. So I will go back to the old folks' home, and you will all stay here... "

I was about to burst into tears. "Grandma, can you stop taking this medicine for a few days? "

MEEMAW didn't say anything.

These drugs, grandma is not good, drug side effects caused her insomnia, headache, constipation, edema, fatigue and weakness. Every time I look at her, I want to throw away those pills.

But then one day she forgot to take her medication, and she had a seizure and passed out. Fortunately, that found in time, mother has been choking her people, choking bleeding, before she woke up. Mother was crying in her arms. It was the first time I had ever seen her cry like that. I could hardly breathe. From then on, meemaw didn't dare to forget to take her medicine for a day.

Grandma touched my head and said, "wrap, grandma heard you say that this disease has an incubation period, and if it doesn't happen within 14 days, then it's proof that no one is infected. I'll stay in the old folks' home for half a month, and if nothing happens, I'll come back. " Grandma's eyes had sunk deep into their sockets, her face was furrowed, but her hands were dry and warm.

"Grandma, you promise me that you will be well and I will wait for you. "

Grandma smiled and nodded.

The next day, my mom couldn't resist, so she moved back to the old folks'home.

At seven o'clock in the afternoon, meemaw called me and said that everything was fine and that I didn't have to worry. She had already returned from the county hospital with medicine. Let me just not tell my mom she went to the hospital to get it.

I said yes, Grandma. I'll wait for you.

Hung up the phone, my heart a little bit loose, secretly pray that grandma will not be infected.

February 5, Chinese New Year, according to custom, to roast mouse claw (local dialect, meaning roast fire) to eat dumplings.

When I was a child, I heard adults say, "age 12, claw. ". Roast hand to roast feet to roast butt to roast waist. Roast neck, roast leg, roast all kinds of diseases. Your family's done my family's done his family's done. The more, the better. The more, the better. No harm, no foul, no foul

But early this morning, the village loudspeakers shouted not to let the roast mouse claws, if anyone secretly roasted to be found, will be pulled to the police station detention for a few days.

MOM kneaded three fresh dumplings at noon, when cooking let me call Bashu to come over to eat. When I called, meemaw said she wasn't coming, and asked me to bring her a bowl.

I put on a mask to go out, the road by a family, pulling a banner in front of the door, "Wuhan Home Students, please do not exchange. ". I pinch my mask and nose clip and pick up the pace.

When we got to the gate of the old house, we opened the gate. Before we entered the house, Grandma's voice came over. "Wrap Up, don't come in. There's a stone by the door. Just put the dumplings on the stone and go home. "

I said, "grandma, I want to see you. "

Grandma smiled and said: "I have nothing to look at, obey, go back. After this half month, I will let you see enough. If you do not go back soon, grandma will be angry with you. "

I was afraid that when grandma got angry, her blood pressure went up again, so I turned around and locked the door. There seemed to be a few coughs coming from the room, but they were gone. I felt that I was jittery, so I patted my face and ran home.

That night, no one in the whole village claws, no firecrackers, the night was a bit eerie silence.

I couldn't sleep. I remembered a few coughs coming from my grandmother's room, and I couldn't sleep.

The next morning I was pushed by my mother to wake up, she said last night she dreamed of Grandma, a little uneasy, and later after breakfast to visit the elderly home.

While my mother was away, I climbed up the iron ladder to the roof. The streets are empty. There's no one here. The Sun, too, was invisible behind the clouds.

After my mother and I put on masks, we walked to the nursing home. When I opened the gate, I found the dumplings were still in the same place.

My mother asked, "why are the dumplings here? "

I ran inside before I could answer. It was bitterly cold in the room, and the coal in the stove had burned to a cinder, and the fire had long since gone out. Grandma was lying in bed with her eyes closed. On the table was a glass of water and a spilled medicine bottle. There were tablets scattered on the floor.

My mind went blank as I walked toward grandma's bed, a man standing in front of me.

I know him. He is the head of the epidemic prevention alley here. He goes from house to house regularly to take body temperature and check the condition of the patient. We just came in and left the door unlocked, and he just happened to be here.

He stopped me and my mother close, gingerly went to the bed, reached out to explore my grandmother's nose, "how to die? "

My mother was shaking like a sieve, and her tears kept falling down. She couldn't say a word. "I don't know, " I cried, holding her

The man immediately called 120, and in a few moments, the medics in protective clothing, the village party secretary and the village director came.

One of the doctors asked, "when did he die? "

Mom still shook her head. "I don't know. "

"Any premortem infections? Fever, cough, respiratory distress, similar... "

"I don't know. "

The Village Party secretary sighed. "You said you were a daughter. You don't even know how your mother died. "

Mother looked up at the village party secretary, "My mother did not contact anyone before her death, you do not suspect her infection. "

"Mom, grandma went to the county hospital the day before yesterday... " I said.

My Mother Stared At me, bewildered. "What did you say? "

I looked away from her eyes, lowered my head and cried. I was wrong. I should have stopped my grandmother from getting the medicine.

The doctor said: "The body has been cold, I can not determine whether she had fever, infection, the detailed results need to be further examined. ". But it wouldn't do much good to dwell on it now that she is certain to be dead. It would be better to cremate her as soon as possible and bury her."

The Village Party secretary said, "yes, Yushang, the doctor is right, or... "

Mother interrupted the village Party secretary, "I'm sorry, I still want to know how my mother died... Old Party secretary, I beg you, help my mother check... "

The Village Party secretary looked at mom, the expression is a little complex, "good, I promise you. However, you and the book package, must go to Ling 'an temple isolation immediately. "

Mother bowed to the secretary, "thank you uncle. " And then turned to the doctor bowed, "thank the doctor. "

Soon, mom and I were sent to the local quarantine site, ling 'an temple. Temple is all around the land, into the eye is half hidden in the soil of the green miserable wheat seedlings, droopy head. Mom and I were put in a room with a window facing the south, just in time to see the sun at its zenith.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
The Heart Sutra hangs in the isolation room

Mom's temp was 36.7. Mine was 37.8. The doctor gave me two boxes of Amoxicillin and three boxes of Lianhua qingwen capsules. Mom and dad got on the phone, Dad and brother were at home, and there was a banner in front of my house.

Mom couldn't stop sighing, and by the end of the day, my temperature had dropped to 36.5 degrees.

Mother sat on the bed staring out of the window, "wrap up, the person died, the virus on the person is also dead? "

I shook my head. "I don't know. "

"The virus infects between the living, can the dead also infect others? " Mother asked me, and seemed to be talking to himself.

I shook my head again.

"Yes. What do you think they'll do with your grandmother's body? "

I still shook my head.

At noon the next day, the village party secretary called to say that the cause of grandma's death had been found. The doctor gave the result of cerebral thrombosis, plus convulsion and loss of consciousness. About thirty seconds later, the person passed away.

The corner of MOM's mouth trembled a bit, just wanted to speak, was interrupted by the village party secretary, "Yushuang, I'm calling to ask you to allow your mother to be cremated right away. As you know, your mother went to the county hospital. Even though she passed away, it's hard to tell who hasn't been infected... "

My mother agreed and asked the Party secretary to leave everything to my father. The Village Party secretary sent my father and brother out to take care of Grandma's affairs.

My father and my brother took their grandmother's body to a garbage dump -- the only other vehicle that could run freely, except for police cars and ambulances.

After the cremation was completed, dad knelt in front of the Bodhisattva Temple in the crematorium and placed three joss sticks. He buried grandma's ashes in his own field and erected a grave head without a monument.

That night, I dreamed of Grandma, she wore this year's new year I gave her red cotton-padded clothes, kneeling in front of the Buddha. Grandma is a devout Buddhist, convert to Bodhisattva side, is probably her peace of mind.

My grandmother is not one of the number of people the country has recorded who have died as a result of this outbreak. Those aren't cold numbers, either. They're real people.

* Illustration provided by the author.

* In order to protect the privacy of the persons concerned, the characters in the articles are assumed names.

—END—

By Chen Shubao

Editor | Han Shui Shui

Submitted by:

Hi, I'm uncle face. Since the outbreak, I've been monitoring the situation in the affected areas. I was in Wuhan University, where there are many of my teachers and friends, now I can do limited, only hope to collect some more stories, for the voice of the people.

Whether you are a medical worker, a social rescuer, a person in an infected area, or a public service provider such as a restaurant, transportation or hotel, I want to hear your true experience and convey your message.

Email: cang1she@163. Com

Fee: 1,500-3,000 yuan per article

Yi Qing Zhi Xia

No one can stay out of this disaster. Hopefully, those who witnessed the outbreak will be able to tell their own stories.
